docs.text: Utilites Remove tracking from git Edit exclude file in .git/info/exclude # git ls-files --others --exclude-from=.git/info/exclude # Lines that start with '#' are comments. # For a project mostly in C, the following would be a good set of # exclude patterns (uncomment them if you want to use them): # *.[oa] # *~ somefile.txt /somedirectory VSCode useful extensions vhdl_ls Linting and syntax correction. (Note: needs vhdl_ls.toml file ins root directory.) vhdl_ls repository vhdl_whiz autocompletion.
docs.title: Utilities

docs.text: Edit exclude file in .git/info/exclude # git ls-files --others --exclude-from=.git/info/exclude # Lines that start with '#' are comments. # For a project mostly in C, the following would be a good set of # exclude patterns (uncomment them if you want to use them): # *.[oa] # *~ somefile.txt /somedirectory
